JUDGES: Angelika Nußberger;Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . He was represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , of ORG . ORG of GPE were invited to state whether they wished to submit written comments on the case ( LAW ) . They did not avail themselves of that possibility .

Before moving to GPE on DATE , the applicant had lived and worked in GPE as a professional soldier for DATE and then as an entrepreneur . He had received a military pension from GPE from DATE . Afterwards , he had received a military pension from GPE until DATE . The applicant was employed in GPE from DATE to DATE . From DATE to CARDINAL DATE and then from DATE to CARDINAL DATE he was registered as unemployed .

On DATE ORG ( PERSON úřad sociálního zabezpečení ) awarded him an old - age pension of CARDINAL NORP korunas ( CZK ) per month ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) starting from DATE . The amount was calculated on the basis of the applicant ’s wage in GPE in DATE together with an unspecified notional amount determined by ORG for the calculation of his military pension . On DATE ORG upheld that decision .

The applicant lodged a request for judicial review arguing , inter alia , that he had been discriminated against on account of his employment in GPE because had he never worked in the country , his pension would be calculated based on section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of ORG on the Application of the Treaty on Social Security ( “ LAW ” ) . In that case it would reach LAW ( EUR CARDINAL ) . He further argued that he had been discriminated against because his income in GPE had not been taken into account at all when calculating his pension .

On DATE ORG ( krajský soud ) upheld the decisions of the administrative authorities , holding that they had correctly applied the NORP - Ukrainian Treaty on ORG ( “ LAW ” ) , the LAW and the relevant law .

On DATE ORG ( GPE správní soud ) dismissed the applicant ’s appeal on points of law ( dovolání ) . It rejected , inter alia , the applicant ’s claim of discrimination , holding that the rule by which the income in another country can not be taken into account when calculating a pension , was justified by technical and practical difficulties and it also protected persons whose pension would be lowered by taking into account low income abroad . The court further stated that it did not consider that any discrimination arose from the fact that section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of the Agreement was not applicable in the applicant ’s case .
On DATE the Constitutional Court ( Ústavní soud ) rejected the applicant ’s constitutional appeal as manifestly ill - founded , agreeing with the ordinary courts .

The entitlement to and the calculation of old - age pensions in GPE of persons having arrived from GPE is governed by the bilateral NORP - Ukrainian Treaty on Social Security of DATE ( “ LAW ” ) and the subsequent Agreement on the Application of LAW of DATE ( “ the Agreement ” ) .
Under LAW undertakes to calculate the average wage or the basis for calculating the pension only on the basis of DATE earned under the law of that ORG .

Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Agreement , when calculating the pension under LAW , no account is taken of any income earned in the other ORG . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) stipulates , however , that if the calculation of a pension is not possible because the person has acquired insurance periods only in the other ORG , the calculation in the NORP Republic shall be based on the average NORP wage DATE the pension is awarded .

Under LAW ( no . CARDINAL ) , the amount of pension is calculated on the basis of the person ’s contribution to the social security scheme during DATE before the date the pension is awarded . However , certain periods are disregarded , including any periods when the person was unemployed , was receiving another pension or the amount of income can not be established . The minimum old age pension under LAW , irrespective of any prior contribution to the scheme , is currently CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) .

Act no . DATE determines the subjects required to contribute to the social security scheme and amounts which have to be paid . Section CARDINAL sets out a list of persons who have to pay social security contributions . It includes , inter alia , employees , self - employed persons , persons in various paid elected ORG offices , civil servants , and shareholders and managers of corporations if they are remunerated for their work .
